response.original_title: What We Do To Nature, We Do To Ourselves
response.overview: The inspiration for the documentary came from the passage of the Lake Erie Bill of Rights in 2019 by voters in Toledo, Ohio and the shutdown of the communityâ€™s water for 3 days after a toxic algae bloom caused by industrial agriculture in NW Ohio.  This full-length documentary was created as a means to inform and generate honesty, and move away from systems and legal structures that do not protect nature or ourselves. The film explores how to move towards a new system, grounded in "right relationship" with water, food, nature, and each other.
response.title: What We Do To Nature, We Do To Ourselves
